result.rationale: The species is a South African endemic described in 2015 from Entabeni State Forest. The species is known only from the type locality, an area which is surrounded by habitat transformed by silviculture, it has an estimated extent of occurrence and an area of occupancy of 4 km². Due to the species having a small restricted distribution range, being known from only one location, with all similar habitats surrounding the only known location having been transformed, and that its current habitat is both not protected and is being degraded by invasive aliens plants, it is assessed as Critically Endangered under criterion B1ab(iii)+2ab(iii).
result.geographicrange: The species is endemic to South Africa and is found in the Limpopo province.
result.population: There is currently no information on the population of this species.
result.habitat: The species builds large orb-webs, usually between trees. It occurs in Afromontane forest fragments within the Savanna biome.
result.threats: The species has lost extensive habitat in the past to afforestation and loss of habitat is ongoing to macadamia nut plantations. It is threatened by silviculture practices surrounding the only known location and its habitat is being degraded by invasive alien plant species.
result.conservationmeasures: The current habitat of the species is currently not protected.
